intro: Hieracium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, showcasing a rosette of basal leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, elongated achenes for seed dispersal. Hieracium balearicum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the mild, wet climate of the Balearic Islands.
